author: D8H
description:
With this behavior, you can make an object rotate like a turret toward a position.
It may be used with the **Bullet** extension to fire objects.
name: Turret
shortDescription: A turret movement with customizable speed, acceleration and stop angles.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: A turret movement with customizable speed, acceleration and stop angles.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Turret

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the turret is moving.
eventsFunctions.name: IsMoving

events.comment: Origin angle is the farest angle from AngleMin and AngleMax, it's used by MoveToward

eventsFunctions.fullName: Set aiming angle toward a position
eventsFunctions.name: SetAimingAngleToward
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the aiming angle of _PARAM0_ toward _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_

events.comment: Use OriginAngle to obtain an angle that is the nearest from AngleMin and AngleMax
Use OriginAngle to obtain an angle that is the nearest from AngleMin and AngleMax
No stop angle, the direction is chosen according to the shortest path (never more that 180°)

eventsFunctions.name: SetAimingAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the aiming angle of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_°

events.comment: Use mod to avoid the angle value to be too large.
There are stop angles, the angle is bounded by these.

eventsFunctions.description: Aiming angle (between 0° and 360° if no stop angle are set).
eventsFunctions.name: AimingAngle

propertyDescriptors.label: Maximum rotation speed (in degrees per second)
propertyDescriptors.name: SpeedMax

propertyDescriptors.label: Maximum angle (use the same value for min and max to set no constraint)
propertyDescriptors.name: AngleMax

propertyDescriptors.label: Minimum angle (use the same value for min and max to set no constraint)
propertyDescriptors.name: AngleMin

propertyDescriptors.label: Origin angle: the farest angle from AngleMin and AngleMax
propertyDescriptors.name: OriginAngle
